title: 115_hr537
content: The "Budget Process Accountability Act" is the short title of the Act. It includes modifications to the exemption from the requirement to maintain health coverage. The "Budget Process Accountability Act" includes a new exemption for individuals in areas with fewer than 2 health insurance issuers offering plans on an Exchange. The amendments made by this section apply to months beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. Health insurance coverage for certain congressional staff and members of the executive branch. Section 1312(d)(3)(D) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to include members of congress, congressional staff, and political appointees in the exchange. It specifies changes regarding coverage for congressional staff, the President, the Vice President, and political appointees. The amendment to Section 1312(d)(3)(D) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act includes political appointees in the exchange, defining them as individuals employed in specific positions under title 5 of the United States Code. The curr_chunk refers to individuals in specific positions in the executive branch of the government with confidential or policy-determining roles. The curr_chunk discusses limitations on government contributions for certain individuals under section 8906 of title 5, United States Code. The curr_chunk outlines restrictions on tax credits and cost sharing for individuals enrolling in health insurance coverage. Members of Congress are also limited in their discretion for staff designations. The curr_chunk clarifies that Members of Congress do not have discretion in determining which employees can enroll in an Exchange for coverage.
